item.description:
UPDATED 01/31/3012

Even though Columbia's official sponsorship ended over a month ago, its time to find out who will be wearing new mid-weight baselayers on their next winter hike. Each set has a suggested retail price of $110.

If you participated in one of the qualifying events between October 1, 2011 and January 31, 2012 you got your name entered into the raffle. The more you participated the more entries you earned. During the four months there were 56 hikes, three bike rides, and one running race.

While not counted towards the raffle, we also had members participate in 26 different educational activities related to the focus of our group - random outdoor adventures. These activities included outdoor leadership, winter hiking and backpacking skills, and various slideshows and presentations about places where we may want to go.

Thanks to the organizers for volunteering their time. I know that it is much easier to just head into the woods without having to think about planning all of the details and listing it - our members appreciate your efforts.

Thanks to each of you for choosing to spend some of our outdoor time with us - we appreciate it. The leadership team is looking forward to seeing the usual suspects and meeting new people in 2012.

Be sure to check our calendar to see what we're doing and sign-up for your next random adventure. There will be plenty of hiking, biking, kayaking, and team tri-athlon/adventure races to choose from.

Never hesitate to suggest an activity if you don't see something that you want to do - I am sure there are others who feel the same way!

 Michael & Monica 

=====

THE WINNER OF THE MEN'S STUFF IS DAN! Dan is from Reading, MA and joined the Random Group on October 20, 2011. Since joining he has participated in six different events. Dan's magic random number was 161.


=====

THE WINNER OF THE WOMEN'S STUFF IS SARAH! Sarah is from Framingham, MA and joined the Random Group on September 24, 2011. Since joining he has participated in five different events. Sarah's magic random number was 53.



=====

=====

UPDATE 12.05.2011: Columbia made a mistake - they sent me more stuff than they said they would. They sent me a men's AND a women's set so I now have a Men's Large top and bottom Miedweight Baselayer and a Women's Small top and bottom Miedweight Baselayer. So when it comes raffle time the first man and first woman selected at random will each get a set. What was good got even better. Be sure to participate in an event between now and Januuary 31 to get your name in the raffle.

Good for Columbia, better for the randomites.

=====

Columbia Sportswear has been gracious

 

enough to sponsor our group AGAIN so that we can keep membership free and continue to offer a wide range of fun and exciting random adventures. Part of this sponsorship includes stuff and just like the stuff they gave us last time, I want to pass this stuff along to you guys.

  • Unfortunately #1: They did not give me enough stuff to give everyone in the group something so I have decided to give one lucky person all of the free stuff. While I could just randomly pick two names from our roster of members I want to reward those of you who have made our group great by participating in our events.
  • Unfortunately #2: They only gave me one set and I had to pick either a men's set or a women's set.  I flipped a coin and picked the men's set - but you don't have to be a man to win. In fact, the winner of the men's jacket this past summer was a women and she was able to return it to Columbia and got to pick something else.

To get your name on the list of potential winners all you have to do is participate in at least one event between no

 

w and January 31, 2012. The more you participate the more chances you get. When it comes time to draw the names the first name I pick gets the stuff.

It’s that simple.

Sorry, if you won last time you can't win this time - but we still want you to come hike with us!

=====

Men's Baselayer Midweight Long Sleeve Top

Suggested Retail Price = $55.00

The best way to bundle up for the backcountry is to pile everything on like a layer cake and then peel it off piece by piece once the sun starts to thaw your frozen world. The perfect cozy baselayer, this midweight thermal long sleeve is this super-soft and Omni-Heat armed. Its Omni-Heat thermal reflective lining uses space blanket technology to trap your body heat without adding bulk, yet still retaining supreme breathability for times when your heart rate hits the red zone. The Midweight Long Sleeve is also durable, and anti pilling, and it fits close to the body for easy layer-ability.


 

FEATURES:

  • Fabric: 86% polyester/14% elastane
  • Omni-Heat thermal reflective
  • Omni-Wick advanced evaporation
  • Form fit
  • Antimicrobial
  • 4-way comfort stretch
  • Ergonomic seaming
  • Imported

=====

Men's Baselayer Midweight Tight with Fly

Suggested Retail Price = $55.00

Soft and sleek but packing an Omni-Heat® punch, this toasty midweight tight features a thermal reflective lining that traps your body heat without adding bulk. Plus, Omni-Wick® technology breathes and wicks sweat away from the body for times when your heart rate hits the red zone. The pant is stretchy, durable, and anti pilling and fits close to the body with a comfy, ergonomic cut. Fly for ease of use.

 


FEATURES:

  • Fabric: 86% polyester/14% elastane
  • Omni-Heat thermal reflective
  • Omni-Wick advanced evaporation
  • Form fit
  • Antimicrobial
  • 4-way comfort stretch
  • Ergonomic seaming
  • Gusset detail
  • Imported
item.name: Member Appreciation Raffle - we get sponsors & you get stuff
